definition: founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
ancestor/forefather/grandparents
surname Zu
surname Shi
teacher/master/expert/model/army division/(old) troops/to dispatch troops
founding master of a monastery/founder/originator

sentences.english: Wilde went on to become homosexual worship the "ancestral."
sentences.chinese: 王爾德甚至成了同性戀者頂禮膜拜的“祖師爺”。

sentences.english: Great Master Yinguang, with huge accomplishment of Confucianism, is the 13th master of the Pure Land Sect.
sentences.chinese: 印光大師是具有豐厚儒學修養的淨土宗十三代祖師。

sentences.english: That Patriarch was very intelligent; he did not have to study to learn Chinese, he just listened.
sentences.chinese: 這位祖師也很聰明的，他學中文不用學，一聽就會了。

sentences.english: In the past, many of the Zen Patriarchs and many students practiced meditation.
sentences.chinese: 記得過去的祖師在修禪，也有很多學者參禪。

sentences.english: Kawabata is one of the pioneers of modernism in Japanese literature.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成是日本文學現代派的開山祖師之一。

sentences.english: This has been a general discussion of Patriarch Bodhidharma's life in China.
sentences.chinese: 這是達摩祖師一生到中國的大概經過。

sentences.english: Bai Yuchan, who was the fifth ancestor of Inner Alchemy of Southern Lineage in Southern Song Dynasty, lived in Wuyi Mountain sometime.
sentences.chinese: 南宋內丹南宗第五代祖師白玉蟾曾經在武夷山生活過。

sentences.english: A carving in Zushih Temple in New Taipei City's Sanxia District, taken on Dec 10.
sentences.chinese: 新北市三峽清水祖師廟內的雕刻，攝於十二月十日。

sentences.english: In these years, the God I believe paves a brilliant way for me in both academic and career developments.
sentences.chinese: 這些年，祖師爺爲我的學業和事業鋪出一道豐盛之路。

sentences.english: Lu Ban was the originator of architecture.
sentences.chinese: 魯班是建築工匠的祖師。

sentences.english: Thus it happened that Patriarch Bodhidharma sailed from India to China.
sentences.chinese: 所以達摩祖師就由印度坐船到中國來了。

definition: Lingbao county level city in Sanmenxia 三門峽|三门峡[San1 men2 xia2], Henan
to vow

gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)

to keep the law/to protect Buddha's teachings/protector of Buddhist law (i.e. temple donor)
to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
Zen Buddhism
sutra/Taoist treatise
solemn/dignified/stately
to instruct (novices)/to preach/to teach/to reveal
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
